content: or use a knot to do the same drop a blob of clear nail polish onto the knot to secure it 27 - thread 2 crystal discs onto each string - if you are using a bead to keep it in place thread it onto the fishing line and then loop back through the bead - attach the strings to the mandala in the same manner as the crystal drops using either a crimp or a knot - attach the longest string to the centre and the shorter strings approximately 6cm on either side of the centre strings 28 2 mirror strings x 2 2 x large plastic crystal drops 2 x plastic crystal discs or a bead will be fine 4 x jewellery crimps or a knot 1 metre of fishing line 8 x 2 5cm cut mirrors epoxy glue super glue will not hold or clear home silicon - crimp or knot the crystal drops into place and thread 1 crystal disc or bead into the centre of each string 29 - put some glue or clear silicon into the centre at the back of the mirror use 2 sets of 2 mirrors glued together per string - position the string so it lies in the centre of the mirror and sits in the blob of glue place another mirror face up onto the 1st mirror and allow to dry - attach 1 on either side of the centre crystal string 30 feather strings i made a few of these in different lengths to fill the gaps and added the feathers in make as few or as many as you like - thread 1 or 2 feathers up into the crimp and a piece of fishing line down through the crimp and squash to secure - you can also glue the feather to one side of a bead and the fishing line onto the other side - thread a few beads into place halfway up the string 31 - thread the string through the mandala and thread beads onto the empty half of the string finish off by crimping more feathers into place to add some finishing textures i cut a few lengths of satin and organza ribbon which were thread ed straight through the mandala you can also thread some beads onto the ribbon for extra bling to fini shell thread a split ring through the top centre of the hoop make sure you thread through the ring and not the stitches now you can hang your magic catcher in a room or a window and hopefully catch some magic 😊 warning unless you have infinite patience and like untangling things for hours we do not advise hanging your gorgeous magic catcher outside in a breezy spot fishing line is very unforgiving 😊 trust me we know 32 33 thank you for your support for m ore visit us on ravelry com/designers/hooked-on-sunshine etsy com/shop/hookedonsunshineza hookedonsunshine co/youtube com instagram com/hooked_on_sunshine/ facebook com/groups/1370975902929963 hookedonsunshine co you can get assistance
